page.title: 01THE VILLAGE OF BALLATER
page.content: Prior to the 1790's Ballater as such did not exist. The nearby settlement of Tullich was the centre of population in the area. The growth of popularity of the spa of Pannanich encouraged the local laird to build the first houses at Ballater to cope with the influx of visitors "taking the waters". At about the same time moves had been made to build a "centrical kirk" on the muir at Ballater. Building was started in 1798. A bridge over the Dee was constructed in 1794. The church became the natural centre for the growing village. By the 1840's Deeside was renowned for its good dry climate. Attracted by this Queen Victoria made her first visit here and in 1854 bought the estate of Balmoral.
